nodes.text: Most of these books seem to be about music and performing, but there's a shelf on gaming as well.
After that book, I know more than I ever wanted to about the Bards that aren't Disbarred.
If the Bards aren't Disbarred, does that make them Barred Bards?
Or maybe they're just Bar Bards.
Music is far more complex and boring in a book than it is to listen to it. No thanks.
Here's a book called, The Tao of Poobah.
So that's what bluffing is all about! And here I thought this was a game of cards rather than cunning and deception.

It isn't just about having the best hand. Sometimes with a really bad set of cards, I may be able to get the other players to fold. I just have to be careful not to do it too often; they'll get suspicious.
Let's see what I can learn about Poobah today.
It turns out that the game is more about what the other players think you hold in your hand than about the cards.
I wonder what I can learn about card games in general? Maybe this book will teach me something.
Interesting. There's a lot to calculating odds of getting certain cards. Who'd have thought it? Math really does have its uses!
Now what do you suppose I can learn about billiards by reading a book?
Hmmm... it turns out, there's a lot to learn by reading a book.
Here's one from the music section: Sha-Na-Na-Na-Nnara: Great Boy Bands of the Four Lands.
Here's a book all about one of the greatest anti-war songs ever written: The Revolution Will Not Be Bas-Reliefed.
Here's another music book: It's a Long Way To Caligari and Other Folk Songs. Ermahgerd! It has my favorite! "Albion Your Dreams!"
Here's another music book: It's a Long Way To Caligari and Other Folk Songs. Ooh, it has my favorite, "Albion Your Dreams!"
